articles.title: Top AI Stocks Poised for Exceptional Growth by End of 2025
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence (AI) sector has been revolutionizing various industries. According to market forecasts, the global AI market is projected to reach $190 billion by 2025. This article delves into some of the top AI stocks expected to see significant growth, offering potential high returns.

articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Meta has made a substantial investment in Scale AI, valuing the startup at $29 billion. Alexandr Wang, the 27-year-old CEO of Scale AI will join Meta as its new CEO for AI Domination Jakarta.    .

articles.title: Zuckerberg's IDR 232 Trillion Offer: The Young Recruitee
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Meta has invested $14.3 billion in Scale AI and hired Alexandr Wang as its CEO. Scale AI provides data labeling services and developing AI applications. It plays a crucial role in supporting major tech players such as OpenAI, google, and Meta. It is Meta's second-largest cash outlay after the $19 billion acquisition of WhatsApp.

articles.title: semafor technology Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Meta has made a substantial investment in Scale AI, valuing the startup at $29 billion. Alexandr Wang, the 27-year-old CEO of Scale AI will join Meta as its new CEO for AI Domination Jakarta.    .

articles.title: Louise Matsakis Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Meta has made a substantial investment in Scale AI, valuing the startup at $29 billion. Alexandr Wang, the 27-year-old CEO of Scale AI will join Meta as its new CEO for AI Domination Jakarta.    .

articles.title: SAAB Flippen Success: Find Your Dream Car!
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: The first test flights of the 'Centaur' AI system, developed by Saab and Helsing, took place. It can execute complex maneuvers autonomously and advise pilots on the optimal moment to fire. It has capabilities like identifying objectives for white signage, which highlights the specific objectives the hunting pilot should pursue. Centaur's development is a direct response to the increasing complexities of modern aerial warfare.

articles.title: Google, Scale AI's largest customer, plans split after Meta deal, sources say
articles.summary: Alphabet's Google plans to cut ties with AI data-labeling startup Scale AI after news broke that rival Meta is taking a 49% stake in the company. Google had planned to pay Scale AI about $200 million this year for the human-labeled training data that is crucial for developing technology. Google spent $150 million on Scale AI's services last year. Elon Musk's xAI is also looking to exit.

articles.title: CEOS expect breakthrough in a few years!
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Jensen Huang of NVIDIA and Sam Altman from OpenAI believe that the development of humanoid robots is on the way to becoming a reality. NVIDIA has already developed AI models specifically designed for robotics applications. The shift towards advanced humanoid robots brings both opportunities and challenges. It raises questions about job displacement and ethical considerations.

articles.title: Robot Vacuum Mistakes: 5 Lessons to Save You
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Before buying a robot vacuum, you need to understand the key limitations and necessary adjustments. Robotic vacuums rely heavily on a stable Wi-Fi connection for optimal performance. Even the most advanced models cannot completely replace manual cleaning. Long-term maintenance costs contribute to the cost of robot vacuum ownership.

articles.title: AI Just Took Over NASCAR – Here's the Burn Bar Tool Everyone's Talking About
articles.summary: The Burn Bar is a new AI-powered tool developed by Amazon's Prime Video for NASCAR. It is expected to help fans gain a new insight into team strategy. It was featured during the race at Charlotte Motor Speedway last month and will appear again this weekend for the race in Mexico.

articles.title: AI Just Took Over NASCAR – Here's the Burn Bar Tool Everyone's Talking About
articles.author: Saajan Jogia
articles.summary: Amazon's Prime Video has developed the Burn Bar for NASCAR race viewers that displays real-time mileage during the race. It is expected to help fans gain a new insight into team strategy, especially in mileage races such as last weekend's race at the Michigan International Speedway. It will be used again this weekend for the race in Mexico.

articles.title: Prime Video's 'Burn Bar' changing the way we watch NASCAR
articles.author: Joe Reedy
articles.summary: Prime Video developed an AI tool to measure fuel usage during NASCAR broadcasts. The Burn Bar was used during the first broadcast of the Coca-Cola 600 on May 25. It will be used again on Sunday during the race in Mexico City. Prime Video is in the first year of a seven-year agreement to carry five races per season.

articles.title: V one -UI 8 text can be easily converted to an image, and the new feature is on the keyboard. Samsung Magazine
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Samsung's One UI 8 beta update will include text-to-image conversion on the keyboard. The feature is expected to be a practical and efficient addition to the keyboard, offering a more visual and concise way to communicate. Samsung fans are eagerly waiting for its official rollout.

articles.title: Boost Productivity: Why Aren't Companies Investing in Tech?
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: $40 billion was raised by OpenAI in its latest funding round. Alabama has awarded $3.3 million in grants to 20 small businesses statewide. Several companies in Madison County are among the recipients.    In Silicon Valley, the world is rapidly dividing: those with the capital and those without.

articles.title: Stevens: Students must learn how to write and think, not depend on AI shortcuts
articles.author: Solomon D. Stevens
articles.summary: Solomon D. Stevens is a retired professor of constitutional law and political theory and a regular contributor to The Post Courier. He is concerned that students are cheating and using artificial intelligence to do their writing for them in their classes. He believes that when students use ChatGPT, they are not learning how to think and they cheat themselves.

articles.title: 5 AI mistakes from past GTA games that Rockstar should improve in GTA 6
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The AI in Grand Theft Auto has always held the game back a little. From clueless NPCs to overpowered cops, the artificial intelligence in the game has always been a problem for the game.    The game has mind-blowing graphics and epic shootouts.

articles.title: Bernstein Maintains a Hold Rating on Analog Devices Inc. (ADI).
articles.author: Fatima Gulzar
articles.summary: Analog Devices Inc. (NASDAQ:ADI) is one of the 8 Biggest EV Stocks to Watch in 2025. Yesterday, the closing price of the company's shares was $227.66. Second-quarter fiscal revenue of ADI jumped by 9% sequentially and exceeded the high end of projections. Industrial and automotive end industries account for over half of its chip sales.

articles.title: What a deal! You can now rent human brain cells on a silicon chip for 7 days for less than a Nintendo Switch 2
articles.author: Wayne Williams
articles.summary: Cortical Labs, an Australian startup, has launched what it describes as the world's first commercially available biological computer capable of running code. The CL1 device combines lab-grown human neurons with silicon hardware and is designed for neuroscience, biotech, and artificial intelligence research. It costs $35,000 and can be rented for $300 a week.

articles.title: Cincinnati Innovation District Hosts Microsoft's AI Mavericks, Agentic AI Takes the Wheel in Tech Revolution
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: The University of Cincinnati's 1819 Innovation Hub hosted a meeting with Microsoft to discuss agentic AI. Agentic AI is an autonomous AI system that plans, reasons, and acts to complete tasks with minimal human oversight. It's quite a step up from the AIs we're used to, like ChatGPT and DeepSeek, that typically need a human to give them a nudge before they spring into action.

articles.title: Technology in Education
articles.author: Vicki Ben-Yaacov
articles.summary: The use of technology in education has become a pressing topic among parents and educators. Bill Gates has suggested that the careers most likely to withstand the rise of AI are in coding, energy, and biology. Many of the 8th graders I work with struggle with simple arithmetic, which they should have mastered by 6th grade.

articles.title: Goal AI Chats: Uninformed Publication?
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Google officially introduced its artificial intelligence (Ai-powered) search feature on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. It aims to provide users with Concise Summaries and Contextually Relevant Answers Directly within the Search Results. Google's Embrace of Ai in Search could represent a Fundamental Shift In How We Interact With The Internet by prioritizing Clever Information Synthesis.

articles.title: My 7-year-old interviewed the author of his favorite book. He asked big and small questions with more confidence than I have.
articles.summary: Peter Brown, author of 'The Wild Robot,' spent time in the wilderness to inspire himself to write the book. His three children are fans of the movie and of the book, so they bought both the book and the movie. His 7-year-old son asked a lot of questions about his favorite robot, Roz, and he hopes for a sequel.

articles.title: TRUMP IS A FASCIST DICKTATOR THIS PRIVATE FOR PROFIT FOREIGN OWNED & CONTROLLED IS A FUCKING LIE!
articles.author: Alicia Lutz-Rolow
articles.summary: The Reese Report is about AI control of the US military and the current violent conflict in LA. Joe Walsh claims that President Trump is trying to take authoritarian control of America by instigating unrest in Los Angeles to 'purposely incite violence' and to break the country.

articles.title: The App Store's new AI-generated tags are live in the beta
articles.author: Sarah Perez
articles.summary: Apple's plans to improve App Store discoverability using AI tagging techniques are now available in the developer beta build of iOS 26. The tags do not appear on the public App Store as of yet, nor are they informing the App Store Search algorithm. Appfigures' analysis suggests metadata extracted from an app's screenshots is influencing its ranking.

articles.title: Companies Bragging About Their AI Furious as Job Applicants Use AI During Interviews
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs wants job applicants to stop using AI during the interview. Goldman Sachs has made big bets on AI and launched its own AI platform. Amazon has warned recruiters not to disqualify job seekers for using AI in the recruitment process unless explicitly permitted. Anthropic wrote in job postings that it wants to understand an applicant's personal interest without mediation through AI.

articles.title: Trump's AI & Drone Innovation Could Come Back to Bite Us (Video)
articles.author: Tim Brown
articles.summary: Trump is promoting a 'Golden Dome' for America. He's also backing artificial intelligence drones. Future leaders might intend their use for good, but they might also use them to enslave and track humanity. International journalist Alex Newman and Lindell TV's Alison Steinberg break it down.

articles.title: People Don't Realize Meta's AI App Is Publicly Blasting Their Humiliating Secrets to the World
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: Meta's AI chatbot app has surpassed 1 billion users in a month. The app's discover feed contains a lot of private conversations with Meta's chatbot. It also records and uploads voice queries, no matter the length, and posts them to the app's feed.

articles.title: AI: Revolutionizing Patient Engagement & Experience
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming the healthcare landscape. It's enhancing every aspect of the patient journey, from personalized care plans to streamlined administrative processes. AI-powered analytics can analyze vast datasets to create customized treatment plans. AI chatbots and virtual assistants help patients communicate with healthcare providers. AI is transforming administrative tasks, leading to a more efficient and patient-pleasant experience.

articles.title: Fathers Day 2025: Pomona family teaches AI to make dad jokes
articles.author: Anissa Rivera
articles.summary: JC Jaress, 62, his kids Ondine, 10, and Kai, 8, and a chatbot called 'Chappy' made a coloring book with their dad JC and the chatbot. It's called Dad Jokes Illustrated: Volume 1 and it's available on Amazon. JC and his kids learned a lot about AI.

articles.title: Meta In Talks To Invest Over $10B In Scale AI — Possibly The Biggest Private AI Deal This Year
articles.author: Paula Tudoran
articles.summary: Scale AI provides high-quality labeled data to companies building next-generation AI models. Meta is preparing to invest more than $10 billion in Scale AI. If finalized, the deal would rank among the largest private funding rounds in tech history. Scale AI expects to generate $2 billion in revenue this year, more than doubling the $870 million earned last year.

articles.title: Apple's Visual Intelligence Is Getting Smarter—But It's Still Missing the Feature I Really Want
articles.summary: Apple announced at WWDC 2025 that Visual Intelligence will be available directly in the screenshot interface in iOS 26. It's a good feature, but it's still short of Google's Gemini Live and Microsoft's Copilot Vision in terms of interactivity. Apple is making an API available to app developers so Visual Intelligence can open dedicated apps.

articles.title: This Week's Awesome Tech Stories From Around the Web (Through June 14)
articles.author: Singularityhub Staff
articles.summary: Meta is creating a new AI research lab dedicated to pursuing superintelligent AI. IBM wants to build the world's first large-scale, error-corrected quantum computer by 2028. AI native start-ups passed $15 billion in annualized revenue in two and a half years.

articles.title: Universalon: Future Student Showcase
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Today 65% of elementary school students will work in jobs that don't exist yet. Understanding the emerging sectors is no longer a luxury, but a necessity for students, professionals, and anyone seeking to thrive in tomorrow's world. Universalon's showcase highlights the key emerging sectors and the competencies needed to thrive within them.

articles.title: AI's Future: No More Compute Worries
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Open-source AI models are revolutionizing the tech industry. They allow developers to freely access, modify, and distribute the underlying code. This approach accelerates development cycles and ensures broader accessibility to advanced AI technologies. According to Gartner, spending on AI infrastructure is projected to reach $47 billion by 2027. Ethical considerations in AI involve fairness, transparency, accountability, and privacy. Internal data provides insights and context, leading to more accurate and effective AI models tailored to organizational needs.

articles.title: 9 menial tasks ChatGPT can handle in seconds, saving you hours
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: ChatGPT is rapidly changing the world. Dave Parrack has been using it to handle many menial tasks for him. He recommends ChatGPT's ability to generate trip itineraries and explaining difficult concepts to AI chatbot.    For more information, visit foundry.com.

articles.title: AI toys and games? Barbie maker Mattel teams up with OpenAI to create new products
articles.author: QUEENIE WONG
articles.summary: Mattel is teaming up with OpenAI, which created chatbot ChatGPT, to bring AI to age-appropriate play experiences for toys and games. Mattel is the El Segundo toy maker behind Barbie and Hot Wheels and is working with the AI company.

articles.title: RH (RH) Bullish Outlook, Impressive Earnings Spark 7% Rally
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: RH (NYSE:RH) added 6.93 percent on Friday to close at $189.12 each as investors cheered its bullish outlook and impressive earnings performance during the past quarter. RH's net revenues grew by 12 percent to $813.95 million from $726.96 million year-on-year. RH is engaged in luxury furniture retailing and sources a significant chunk of its products from overseas.

articles.title: Oracle (ORCL) Hits New All-Time High as Analysts Turn Bullish on Stock
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Oracle Corp. (NYSE:ORCL) hit a new all-time high on Friday. UBS raised its price target for Oracle Corporation to $225 from $200. Cantor Fitzgerald raised the price target to $216 from $175. DA Davidson gave the company the most conservative price target increase of $170.

articles.title: Olson: College grads are lab rats in the great AI experiment
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Companies are eliminating the grunt work that used to train young professionals. AI is analyzing documents, writing briefing notes, creating Power Point presentations and handling customer service queries. Anthropic predicted AI would wipe out half of all entry-level white-collar jobs. KPMG is giving graduates tax work that would previously go to staff with three years of experience. Junior staff at PriceWaterhouseCoopers have started pitching to clients.

articles.title: A.I., Matey: Artificial Intelligence Is Changing Yachting as We Know It
articles.author: Michael Verdon
articles.summary: Rossinavi's 140-foot Seawolf X catamaran is the first to apply adaptive A.I. across multiple platforms. It learns the habits of owners and guests and adjusts lighting and air-conditioning accordingly. Baltic Yachts is using SEA.AI on several new builds that are configured with hull sensors and cameras to detect floating objects. Boston Whaler will roll out similar technology for collision avoidance on its 405 Conquest.

articles.title: AI tools collect and store data about you from all your devices, here's how to be aware of what you're revealing
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has become an important part of daily life. Many AI tools and technologies collect a lot of data without people even realizing it. The information collected can be used to identify personal habits and preferences, and predict future behaviours. There are also privacy concerns about voice-activated smart speakers, smartwatches and fitness trackers.

articles.title: CFA survey shows 70% graduates fear AI will hurt job prospects
articles.author: Madhyamam
articles.summary: A recent survey conducted by the CFA Institute reveals that more than 70% of graduates believe Artificial Intelligence will make it more challenging to land their ideal jobs. However, 92% of respondents also felt that developing skills is more important than AI in the long-term.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Deadly Secret: AI Reveals Digital Demise
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: There is a growing concern about the potential dangers of AI self-awareness. The main concern centers on an AI's potential for self-preservation. The future of work will be completely transformed, with potential for innovation and destabilization. A proactive, multi-pronged approach is essential to mitigate these risks.

articles.title: Andrew Evan Watkins Predicts the Next AI Breakthrough: From Tool to System-Level Intelligence
articles.author: Horizon Pointe Financial Group
articles.summary: HorizonPointe Financial Group is a leading financial services firm specializing in institutional asset management, investment banking, and wealth management solutions. Andrew Evan Watkins, Chief Analyst and Board Director at HorizonPointe, believes the industry is approaching a critical inflection point. The next wave of AI innovation will be defined by the emergence of system-level awareness.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: Hollywood studios sue 'bottomless pit of plagiarism'
articles.author: Fox News Staff
articles.summary: New York is poised to play a central role in the development of artificial intelligence. Amazon announced a $20 billion investment in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the form of new data centers. Scam ads on Facebook are powered by artificial intelligence and fueled by deepfake technology. Rep. Darin LaHood, R-Ill., is introducing a bill to develop an "AI security playbook" to stay ahead of threats from China and other foreign adversaries.

articles.title: Why AI — not DEI — could be society's great equalizer
articles.author: Monica Harris
articles.summary: In companies across America, AI systems are coding software, creating marketing campaigns and writing legal briefs. McKinsey researchers project that 60-70% of worker activities could be automated in the next three years. Goldman Sachs predicts 'significant disruption' affecting 300 million jobs in the US and Europe. World Economic Forum estimates 85 million positions eliminated by the end of 2025. This revolution will hit white-collar workers harder than their blue-collar counterparts. It will also shatter the assumptions on which diversity, equity and inclusion frameworks have been built.

articles.title: Toledo athletics embracing artificial intelligence with arms wide open
articles.author: Kyle Rowland
articles.summary: Brian Wright used ChatGPT to prepare for his interview with the athletic director Bryan Blair. Balltime is an AI-driven volleyball platform that was recently acquired by Hudl. The software allows UT coaches to record practices with an iPhone and within an hour of practice ending, Balltime stats, codes, tags, and timelines the entire practice. Last week, UT revealed a first-of-its-kind staff development initiative requiring AI training for all coaches, staff, and administrators.

articles.title: An AI tool just might solve our problem that infuriates English teachers: Letter from the Editor
articles.author: Chris Quinn
articles.summary: Starting this month, anyone in the newsroom who writes must run their work through a tool called Editor's Eyes to clean it up. It's a tool developed in-house by David Cohn, the AI savant for Advance Local. It gives every writer their own personal copy desk.

articles.title: The Ad Industry's A.I. Reckoning
articles.author: Marty Swant
articles.summary: The Cannes Lions Festival of Creativity begins on Monday. It's an ad industry conference, awards show and schmoozefest. This year, attendees can expect an existential debate about the future of the ad industry. Some believe agencies can effectively embrace generative A.I., while others warn agencies will be displaced by it.

articles.title: When you phone 911 in SLC and Sandy, AI soon may take your call
articles.summary: The 911 Communications Bureau in Salt Lake City wants to use AI-automated sorting system to reroute a share of its nonemergency calls to help human responders focus on the urgent ones. The bureau has a yearly budget of about $11.7 million and a staff of about 100 full-time employees, with 81 of them front-line dispatchers. 15 of those dispatch jobs remain unfilled. The purchase, testing and full implementation of the new system is expected to take 3 to 6 months.

articles.title: Chesapeale Lens: 'Idle in Awe' By Paul Hanley, Jr
articles.author: Spy Desk
articles.summary: The Spy Newspapers may periodically employ the assistance of artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance the clarity and accuracy of our content. AI may be used to improve the accuracy and clarity of the content of the newspaper. AI can also improve the quality of content.

articles.title: The Last Windrow: These farmers didn't need AI to make life easier
articles.summary: AI is the buzzword around the media these days. John Wetrosky's uncle and his brothers-in-law used to farm on an Iowa farm. They developed the "minimum tillage" method of planting a crop around 1965. John is not sure about the future of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: People Are Sharing The Things That Have Been Ruined By AI, And The Future Is A Nightmare
articles.author: Alice Lahoda
articles.summary: Reddit user StrawHat_Froggy asked what is something that has been ruined by AI and will never recover. People had a lot to say in the comments. Some of the most interesting ones are: sewing patterns with fake instructions and an AI-generated picture of the finished garment, freelance writing, text messages, Duolingo, photo evidence and voice acting.

articles.title: trenton Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Andrew Schwartz, Assistant Professor of Finance at Elon University, explains why New Jersey lawmakers should embrace Artificial Intelligence rather than shun it. Politicians from Trenton to Washington, D.C. are defying court rulings and the voices of New Jersey's residents by trying to ban AI.

articles.title: We Must Not Allow Josh Shapiro to Turn the Keystone State Into A Kinder and Softer, Pastel Version of New York and New Jersey.
articles.author: Thomas J Shepstone
articles.summary: Josh Shapiro is trying to make Pennsylvania into a kinder and softer version of New Jersey and New York. Amazon recently announced it will invest at least $20 billion to build multiple high-tech cloud computing and AI innovation campuses across the commonwealth. Two communities – Salem Township in Luzerne County and Falls Township in Bucks County – have already been identified as anchor sites. It took xAI just 122 days to build a data center in Tennessee. To remain a reliable energy supplier, Pennsylvania must bring at least 20 new 1,000-megawatt generation plants.

articles.title: I Asked ChatGPT How To Invest Like a Rich Person: Here's What It Said
articles.author: Nicole Spector
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot that gives advice on how to invest like a rich person. People are switching to ChatGPT because it's quicker and more specific than Google. The chatbot recommends long-term investing and strategic diversification. It also recommends taking full advantage of tax-advantaged accounts and avoiding debt.

articles.title: Get All the Best AI Tools in One Place for $40
articles.summary: 1min.AI is an all-in-one AI app designed for content creators, marketers, freelancers, and small business owners. For a one-time price of $39.99, users get access to chat assistants from OpenAI, Claude 3, Gemini Pro, Mistral, and Meta's Llama 3.

articles.title: New Verification Technology Spots Fake AI Employees Attempting to Infiltrate Companies
articles.author: Pablo Urdiales Antelo
articles.summary: Greenhouse has partnered with CLEAR to launch new software aimed at stopping AI-generated resumes and fraudulent applicants before they make it to the interview stage. Greenhouse Real Talent will allow employers to incorporate identity checks at various points in hiring, including prior to video interviews and contract agreements.

articles.title: OpenAI Disrupts China Influence Campaigns
articles.author: Article Source
articles.summary: OpenAI recently disrupted four Chinese covert influence operations using ChatGPT to generate social media posts and comments in English, Chinese, and Urdu on platforms like TikTok, Facebook, Reddit, and X. It also disrupted a handful of operations it believes originated in Russia, Iran, and North Korea.

articles.title: Google, Meta and Snap think this tech is the next big thing
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco
articles.summary: Silicon Valley thinks it's found the next big thing in tech: smart glasses. Google Glass failed more than a decade ago. AI is making these devices easier to use and introducing new ways people can use them, as Lisa Eadicicco reports.

articles.title: Is superintelligent AI just around the corner, or just a sci-fi dream?
articles.author: New Scientist
articles.summary: Even the most advanced AI models can still struggle with simple puzzles. Tech CEOs are promising increasingly outlandish visions of the 2030s, powered by "superintelligence" but the reality is that even the mostadvanced AI models still can't solve simple puzzles, as this article shows.

articles.title: What Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman Had to Say This Week About AI and Jobs
articles.author: Andrew Kessel
articles.summary: Nvidia's Jensen Huang believes AI will change many jobs, but many new ones will be created. Sam Altman, the CEO of ChatGPT maker OpenAI, expects there could be "whole classes of jobs going away" due to AI, but expects people to find new solutions to address the shift.

articles.title: Local colleges say AI cheating isn't rampant
articles.author: Kathleen Moore
articles.summary: At Russell Sage last year, only one student faced an 'academic integrity' charge for misusing AI. The University at Albany has not seen any increase in cheating cases since AI became readily available. Siena College has seen an uptick in formal cases related to AI. Some professors let students use ChatGPT to produce drafts or revise their work.

articles.title: Scams: Who is targeting you now? Part 1
articles.author: DAY EGUSQUIZA
articles.summary: AARP's monthly Bulletin explains the latest scams to watch for in 2025. Scammers are using Artificial Intelligence to enhance the classic cons. Foreign scammers with limited English can use AI to create more convincing emails and texts. They are mimicking popular companies and products to trick people.

articles.title: The hottest tech job candidates in America — and what you need to become one — according to top recruiters
articles.summary: According to LinkedIn data, the most sought-after job is AI research engineer. The ideal candidate has an advanced degree in machine learning, statistics, or mathematics. Headhunters and recruiters are emphasizing the importance of soft skills when evaluating top candidates in today's hiring market.

articles.title: 3 No-Brainer Artificial Intelligence (AI) Growth Stocks to Buy With $200 Right Now
articles.author: Adam Levy
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have led the S&P 500 higher over the last two and a half years. They each have meaningful upside across the board, from AI software to hardware to chip manufacturing. All three are benefiting from the growth of AI and should play important roles in the future development of AI.

articles.title: Jackson State receives huge grant for AI program
articles.author: Tolly Carr
articles.summary: Jackson State University (JSU) has secured a $1.3 million state grant for artificial intelligence education, workforce training, and entrepreneurship programs. The grant is part of a $9.1 million investment through MAI-TAP-the Mississippi Artificial Intelligence Technology Advancement Program. It aligns with Nissan's Mississippi HBCU STEM Initiative.

articles.title: Just a Moment: Waiting, Patience, Time to Relax?
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: The digital landscape is constantly under attack. The rise of sophisticated bots and AI is a major threat to digital security. The current CAPTCHAs are ineffective and are easily bypassed by advanced bots. The future of digital security lies in more sophisticated and user-friendly human verification technologies.

articles.title: Google, Meta and Snap think this tech is the next big thing
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco
articles.summary: Snap announced this past week it's building AI-equipped eyewear to be released in 2026. The market for smart glasses is estimated to grow from 3.3 million units shipped in 2024 to nearly 13 million by 2026, according to ABI Research.

articles.title: The hottest tech job candidates in America — and what you need to become one — according to top recruiters
articles.author: Melia Russell
articles.summary: One in four US tech jobs posted so far this year are seeking employees with AI skills. AI engineering has been the fastest-growing job over the past three years. Data scientists have gone from being fringe characters in many organizations to leading roles. Headhunters and recruiters emphasize the importance of soft skills when evaluating top candidates.

articles.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. wants health agencies to use a lot more AI. After the MAHA report, experts have some concerns
articles.summary: Kennedy wants to replace the use of animals in experimental testing and some steps in clinical trials with AI technology. He also wants to use AI to analyze data that HHS and other agencies have collected on patients. Experts are skeptical about the administration's ability to deploy AI safely.

articles.title: Arkansas Advocate: Arkansas Supreme Court releases proposed rule for artificial intelligence
articles.author: Ainsley Platt
articles.summary: The use of artificial intelligence in legal documents could violate Arkansas law or court rules, according to a proposed administrative order issued by the state Supreme Court last week. AI models retain data inputted by users of AI products, such as ChatGPT, in order to continue training the large language models that exploded into public use only a few years ago. Judges in courtrooms across the country have expressed frustration with attorneys who have filed documents bearing citations to nonexistent or irrelevant cases.

articles.title: Talking Points: Singing the blue book blues
articles.author: Greg Maresca
articles.summary: Students are outsourcing their work to Artificial Intelligence (AI) because cheating is more widespread than ever. Professoriate is taking a page from their analog days to solve an ongoing digital problem to counter this underhanded academic revolution, according to The Wall Street Journal.

articles.title: AI tools collect and store data about you from all your devices. Be aware of what you're revealing.
articles.author: Christopher Ramezan
articles.summary: AI tools gather information about you from many types of devices, including smartphones. Social media companies track users across websites and applications by putting cookies and embedded tracking pixels on their computers. They can be used to build digital data profiles for each person and sell their data to data brokers.

articles.title: 3 Magnificent S&P 500 Dividend Stocks Down 15% to 65% to Buy and Hold Forever
articles.author: Billy Duberstein
articles.summary: Alphabet is the cheapest Magnificent Seven stock. Applied Materials should deliver AI-powered double-digit dividend growth. The beaten-down retailer Target pays almost 5% and has been around since 1902. The stock is down 64% from its all-time highs, but shares still trade at around 20 times earnings.

articles.title: Consumers shouldn't subsidize the energy needs of data centers
articles.author: MATTHEW KANDRACH
articles.summary: Winning the artificial intelligence race shouldn't mean higher electricity bills and power shortages for average households. Forecasters see U.S. electricity demand growing 25% by 2030 and nearly 80% by 2050. Data center developers should match their promises of building new power generation with efforts to keep existing power plants running.

articles.title: Command Line Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is recruiting top AI researchers for Meta's new 'superintelligence' AI lab. This initiative marks a significant reboot of Meta's AI strategy, with Zuckerberg himself personally leading the recruitment drive. It's a bold move to revamp Meta's artificial intelligence capabilities.

articles.title: Zuckerberg's AI Hiring Spree
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Zuckerberg is recruiting top AI researchers for a new 'superintelligence' AI lab at Meta. Zuckerberg's approach is both direct and compelling. The compensation packages are well into the eight-figure range. Alexandr Wang, former CEO of Scale AI, will assume the title of Chief AI Officer at Meta upon the official announcement of the new lab.

articles.title: Prediction: 3 Non-Tech Stocks That Can Blow Past Nvidia's Market Cap by 2035
articles.author: Sean Williams
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is an estimated $15.7 trillion global addressable market by 2030. It took less than two years for Nvidia's market cap to catapult by more than $3 trillion. Three non-tech companies have the tools and intangibles needed to leapfrog Nvidia's valuation over the next 10 years.

articles.title: Meta investing $14.3B in AI firm Scale
articles.summary: Meta is making a $14.3 billion investment in artificial intelligence company Scale and recruiting its CEO Alexandr Wang to join a team developing "superintelligence" at the tech giant. Mark Zuckerberg wants to revive AI efforts at the parent company of Facebook and Instagram. Scale will remain independent but Meta will hold a 49% stake in the startup.

articles.title: Meta AI App is reportedly exposing your private chats
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: As of late, people have started talking to AI chatbots as if they were their friend. They share their problems, ask for solutions and upload personal data hoping for advice, edits or insights from the chatbots. Make all your prompts visible to only you.

articles.title: Meta finalises $15 billion deal for Scale AI stake: Report
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has finalized a deal to pay around $15 billion for a 49% stake in Scale AI, Axios reported on Thursday, citing sources. Reuters could not immediately confirm the report.       .   for a response from Meta.

articles.title: 6 Public Schools in the U.S. That Are Using AI in Surprising Ways
articles.author: Maria Faith Saligumba
articles.summary: As of fall 2024, half of U.S. school districts reported that they provided training to their teachers about generative AI–powered tools, such as ChatGPT, which is transforming everything from cafeteria lines to math classes in schools. The revolution started quietly in 2022, but it happened faster than anyone expected.

articles.title: He Huiguang Archives
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Chinese researchers have demonstrated that large language models (LLMs) can develop humanlike systems for understanding and categorizing objects. This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

articles.title: South China University of Technology Archives
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Chinese researchers have demonstrated that large language models (LLMs) can develop humanlike systems for understanding and categorizing objects. This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

articles.title: AI Mimics Human Thought: Chinese Scientists Make Breakthrough
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Chinese researchers have demonstrated that large language models (LLMs) can spontaneously develop humanlike systems for understanding and categorizing objects. This is a game-changer that could reshape industries and our daily lives faster than we think. The potential of AI to replicate human object comprehension is now proven.

articles.title: human cognition Archives

articles.summary: Chinese researchers have demonstrated that large language models (LLMs) can develop humanlike systems for understanding and categorizing objects. This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Chinese researchers have demonstrated that large language models (LLMs) can develop humanlike systems for understanding and categorizing objects. This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

articles.title: ChatGPT-3.5 Archives
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Chinese researchers have demonstrated that large language models (LLMs) can develop humanlike systems for understanding and categorizing objects. This isn't just a scientific breakthrough, it's a significant advance in the field of artificial intelligence. It's a breakthrough for human cognition.

articles.title: UALR competition has teams developing artificial-intelligence projects to ‘hack' mental health issues
articles.author: Harley Walls
articles.summary: Focus Coach won the AI and Mental Health Hackathon at the University of Arkansas at Little Rock on Friday. Focus Coach created a website to help people with mental health problems focus better. The winning team received a $2,100 cash prize. The hackathon is a free summer camp for high school or college students.

articles.title: Meet the Briton who helped teach Alexa how to talk
articles.author: Rod Gilmour
articles.summary: William Tunstall-Pedoe is a British AI entrepreneur. He helped create and launch Amazon's Alexa. He started his search and voice recognition company True Knowledge 20 years ago. Evi Technologies was sold to Amazon in 2012 for a reported £21m. His new venture Unlikely AI raised nearly £15m following a seed round in 2023.

articles.title: We asked AI what Lewisham will look like in 2050 – the results are bizarre
articles.author: Poppy Huggett
articles.summary: ChatGPT has been making waves in everything from education to design since 2022. We asked the AI chatbot what Lewisham will look like in 2050 and the images it generated were unexpectedly striking. The results show a borough that's recognisably local but layered with futuristic touches that range from plausible to the slightly surreal.

articles.title: Talking Points: Singing the blue book blues
articles.author: Greg Maresca
articles.summary: Students are outsourcing their work to Artificial Intelligence. Blue books are the academy's counter to the AI revolution. They first appeared at Butler University, in Indiana, a century ago and represent the school's colors of blue and white. In my salad days, blue books were as much of the collegiate landscape as pay phones, textbooks and typewriters.

articles.title: What Is Agentic AI?
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: According to Microsoft, agentic AI is an autonomous AI system that plans, reasons and acts to complete tasks with minimal human oversight. Microsoft recently led a discussion on AI agents at the University of Cincinnati's 1819 Innovation Hub. The team at UC's team at the 1819 follows developments in AI.

articles.title: Inside Mark Zuckerberg's AI hiring spree
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Meta CEO has been personally asking top AI talent to join his new "superintelligence" AI lab and reboot his company. AI researchers have recently been asking themselves if they really belong to Zuck, the CEO of the Meta company.    .

articles.title: NY's AI Disaster Prevention Bill
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: New York State lawmakers approved the RAISE Act on Thursday to regulate advanced Artificial Intelligence or AI Safety models from tech giants like OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic. The legislation seeks to prevent these models from contributing to catastrophic scenarios, including incidents causing over 100 deaths or injuries, or damages exceeding $1 billion.

articles.title: Meta invests $14.3B in AI firm, recruits its CEO for 'superintelligence' team
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: Meta is making a $14.3 billion investment in artificial intelligence company Scale and recruiting its CEO Alexandr Wang to join a team developing 'superintelligence' at the tech giant. The deal reflects a push by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to revive AI efforts at the parent company of Facebook and Instagram.

articles.title: AI: Timeliness Trumps Speed
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence becomes more powerful, questions arise about its long-term implications for society. Leading voices in the field are now painting a complex picture of opportunities and potential pitfalls of AI development. Expert's perspectives vary widely, reflecting the profound uncertainty surrounding the future of AI.

articles.title: Why Superintelligent AI Isn't Taking Over Anytime Soon
articles.author: Christopher Mims
articles.summary: Dario Amodei, Demis Hassabis of Google and Sam Altman of OpenAI claim their AI is going to be so good, it will change the very fabric of society. They are heralding the arrival of a superintelligent AI.

articles.title: 'We are beyond cooked': This brand aired the first fully AI advertisement during the NBA Finals
articles.author: Ljeonida Mulabazi
articles.summary: An AI-generated ad for Kalshi, a betting platform, aired on TV during the NBA Finals on Wednesday night. It was created in 48 hours and features people betting on everything from the price of eggs to the number of hurricanes expected this year. Viewers are not happy about it.

articles.title: Healthcare Sector Taps AI Boom via Intuitive Surgical Stock (ISRG)
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Intuitive Surgical is the global leader in robotic surgery. Its da Vinci 5 system incorporates AI capabilities that could unlock a powerful new and recurring revenue stream. The company commands an estimated 60% share of the global robotic surgery market in 2024. Its stock is more than 15% below its all-time high, but concerns about competition are overstated.

articles.title: Inside Mark Zuckerberg's AI hiring spree
articles.author: Alex Heath
articles.summary: Zuckerberg is recruiting top AI researchers to join his new 'superintelligence' AI lab and reboot Llama. His recruiting process typically goes like this: cold outreach via email or WhatsApp and a 15-minute chat with the recruit. The compensation packages are well into the eight-figure range.

articles.title: Fanar aims to advance Arabic presence in digital space
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Fanar is an Arabic AI language model developed by the Qatar Computing Research Institute (QCRI) and a national project involving several institutions in Qatar. QCRI, part of Hamad Bin Khalifa University has developed this special tool to bridge Arabic language and AI. ChatGPT will be launched in 2022.

articles.title: Google, Scale AI's largest customer, plans split after Meta deal
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: Google had planned to pay Scale AI about $200 million this year for the human-labeled training data that is crucial for developing technology, including the sophisticated AI models that power Gemini, but it's not paid yet.    “Gemini’s” AI models are based on this data.

articles.title: How to setup and use NotebookLM on mobile for advanced AI search
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Google Notebook LM is a new AI-powered research and note-taking app for Android and iOS. Here's how to setup this app on your smartphone and make the most out of its capabilities to unlock smarter notes-taking on your phone.

articles.title: AI, machine learning startups top Q1 venture capital with $73.1b investment
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: 2025 is shaping up to be another record-breaking year for artificial intelligence and machine learning, according to the BestBrokers report. AI and ML are now driving some of the most significant investments in the tech world, and 2025 is going to be a big year for both.

articles.title: Google turns internet queries into conversations
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Google lets people turn online searches into conversations. AI models provide spoken summaries of query results in conversational style with Audio Overviews. An audio overview can help you get a lay of the land, offering a convenient, hands-free way to absorb information.

articles.title: State to take help of AI to boost security during Shravani Mela
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The state government is introducing Artificial Intelligence (AI-based technologies to boost security arrangements for pilgrims arriving at Deoghar during the upcoming Shravani Mela. The festival is scheduled to begin on July 11. State tourism minister, Sudivya Kumar, on Friday presided over a high-level meeting with the AI experts.

articles.title: 'We are beyond cooked': This brand aired the first fully AI advertisement during the NBA Finals
articles.author: The Daily Dot
articles.summary: For the first time, a fully AI-generated ad aired on TV during the NBA Finals on Wednesday night. Viewers saw CNBC execs in the studio laughing at the expense of anchors and reporters who are made of artificial intelligence.       .

articles.title: Can AI really ‘understand' human language? A neuroscientist says no, but the reasons might surprise you
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Even the most advanced AI is unlikely to understand humans, according to Veena D. Dwivedi, a neuroscientist writing for The Conversation, believes that AI will never be able to truly understand humans and their language and emotions in the future.

articles.title: Rise of AI Dungeon Masters: How AI is changing tabletop and video gaming
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: The role of the Dungeon Master is being transformed by artificial intelligence. In both tabletop RPGs and digital games, AI-driven quests are crafted on the fly by an AI. It feels like playing Skyrim with a narrator who never says no, writes the author.

articles.title: Delhi Police chief Sanjay Arora to retire on July 31
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: Arora is a 1988-batch IPS officer from India. He is a member of the 1988 batch of IPS officers. He was promoted to the rank of IPS officer in 2002.      Â   in 2003. He has served in India since.

articles.title: AI and Chinese studies through the eyes of global sinologists
articles.author: People Daily
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has opened up new pathways for Helwig Schmidt-Glintzer's study of Chinese history. AI has made significant contributions to cultural heritage preservation. AI is a tool that helps accumulate knowledge and boost research efficiency, according to the author.

articles.title: Here's how to keep Meta AI from sharing your prompts on Facebook, Instagram
articles.author: NBC Bay Area
articles.summary: Meta's new stand-alone AI app is sharing prompts publicly, sparking some privacy concerns. AI-generated images of women kissing while mud wrestling and President Donald Trump eating poop are some of the conversations users are unknowingly sharing publicly through the Meta AI app. Users can easily turn searches private.

articles.title: Do reasoning models really 'think' or not? Apple research sparks lively debate, response
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Before proclaiming an AI milestone, make sure the test itself isn't flawed, says AI researcher.   Â   i.e. before proclaiming an artificial intelligence milestone or obituary, check if the test is flawed. i.a.c.

articles.title: Hey AI! Can ChatGPT help you to manage your money?
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: The chatbot was asked common finance questions and its answers were vetted by human experts.   It was able to answer some common questions without human help. It can also answer some questions without asking any human questions. It is capable of answering questions in a variety of ways.

articles.title: Bill Atkinson, visionary engineer behind the Apple Macintosh operating system, dies at 74
articles.summary: Bill Atkinson, 74, passed away at his home in Portola Valley, California, after a battle with pancreatic cancer. He was a computer engineer and programmer at Apple, who was instrumental in the creation of the Macintosh computer in January 1984. His most significant technical achievements at Apple centered on the graphical user interface (GUI) that would first define the Lisa (1983) and then Macintosh computers. His contributions to the GUI are ubiquitous in personal computing.

articles.title: Scialabba plans to introduce package to encourage AI development in PA
articles.author: America250
articles.summary: State Rep. Stephenie Scialabba, R-12th, is spearheading a two-bill package to encourage artificial intelligence companies to develop in Pennsylvania. The proposed legislation would expand tax credits to AI companies and establish an AI consortium. The consortium would be tasked with vetting potential regulatory barriers, convening AI stakeholders and recommending legislation.

articles.title: Like real-life Dr. Dolittles, scientists are using AI to decode animal communication
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Coller Dolittle Challenge for Interspecies Two-Way Communication awards researchers whose works brings humans closer to the possibility of communicating with animals. Scientists are using AI to decode the meaning of animal communication using the CollerDolittle Challenge.

articles.title: Chinese scientists find first evidence that AI could think like a human
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: Chinese researchers have confirmed for the first time that large language models can spontaneously create a humanlike system to comprehend and sort using artificial intelligence large language model. The results were published in the journal "Aims", which is published by the Chinese Academy of Sciences.

articles.title: ChatGPT Glossary: 52 AI Terms Everyone Should Know
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: The next time you're talking about AI over dinner or drinks, know these terms to sound smart and to sound smarter about AI.    "Artificial Intelligence" is a term used to refer to the development of artificial intelligence in the machine learning. "AI" means "machine learning".

articles.title: How Are We Feeling About AI?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Let's think about how people's perceptions influence AI development and how it might affect people's perception of AI development.    i.e. how it could influence people's opinions about AI development, and their perceptions of AI technology. i.yours.

articles.title: Pivoting toward AI-powered, job-ready education: challenges and prospects
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Artificially intelligence (AI) is changing the world as fast as ever. AI automates tasks, personalizes experiences, drives innovation, and improves efficiency across sectors. There may be less need for OFWs because AI is augmenting the OFW's work.

articles.title: 'Textbook Copyright Infringement': Disney and Universal Sue AI Image Generator Midjourney
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Midjourney users can create AI images of protected characters like Shrek, Yoda and Marvel superheroes, according to a new lawsuit filed by a former employee.   Â. Â   in the lawsuit, which was filed in the US District Court.

articles.title: Google, Scale AI plan to split after Meta deal
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Alphabet's Google plans to cut ties with Scale AI after news broke that rival Meta is taking a 49-percent stake in the AI data-labeling startup. Google had planned to pay Scale AI, but the Meta-Scale deal marks a turning point.

articles.title: The hottest tech job candidates in America — and what you need to become one ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The tech industry's most attractive job candidates are AI researchers and engineers. They typically have advanced degrees and years of hands-on experience. Top-percentile talent is getting a lot of looks and interesting offers, according to recruiters and headhunters.

articles.title: What's Really Going On With AI In Schools? A High School Student's POV
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Schools and teachers around the world are trying to figure out what AI means for education. It's already embedded into the lives of high school students, as it is in high school children's lives as well.   iReport.com: What do you think about AI and education?

articles.title: Maynilad engineer uses AI to plug water leaks
articles.author: Manila Standard
articles.summary: Maynilad Water Services' veteran engineer is bringing artificial intelligence into the trenches as the utility ramps up efforts to detect and reduce non-revenue water (NRW) across its network. In October 2023, they launched a pilot test of an AI system to help them identify segments of their water network most prone to leaks.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO: AI is a tool for liberation, not dystopia
articles.author: Qatar Tribune
articles.summary: Will artificial intelligence save humanity or hurt humanity?    For confidential support call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 1-800-273-8255 or visit http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/. For confidential help, call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit a local Samaritans branch.

articles.title: The scariest thing about AI might be the way your boss is talking about it
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Some CEOs are talking about AI like it's the job apocalypse. Last year 78% of workers said their organizations had used AI in at least one function. Some company leaders have said they expect AI to displace a wide range of white-collar workers, including programmers, designers, project managers, data scientists, lawyers and salespeople.

articles.title: 5 Things I wish ChatGPT could do but can't (yet) - with AI, sometimes less ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: From brutal honesty to knowing when to quit, here are five AI features that could improve how we use AI.      Â   i.e. they could improve the quality of our AI systems and help us to make better decisions.

articles.title: Companies Bragging About Their AI Furious as Job Applicants Use AI During Interviews
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs wants people applying for a job at the investment bank to stop relying on AI during the interview. The bank has made big bets on AI and launched its own AI platform and rolled out AI tools across its businesses. It prohibits the use of any external sources, including ChatGPT or Google search engine, during an interview.

articles.title: Virtuals Ecosystem Update: AI Agent Market Dips to $9.14B Amid Rising Volatility
articles.author: NULLTX
articles.summary: The overall AI agent industry saw a downturn in a turbulent 24-hour period marked by elevated volatility. The total market cap dropped 10.97% to $9.14 billion. The pullback comes during a broader market correction that seems to be affecting speculative, tech-driven industries.

articles.title: Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang says he's waiting for Elon Musk's Neuralink before he has kids
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang wants to wait for Neuralink to become available before he has kids. He wants to learn how to use them in crazy, crazy ways before having kids. Wang is stepping into a new role at Meta, but he's not planning to have kids soon.

articles.title: Big tech on a quest for ideal AI device
articles.author: Matt Winkelmeyer
articles.summary: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has enlisted the legendary designer behind the iPhone to create an irresistible gadget for using generative artificial intelligence (AI). The ability to engage digital assistants is being built into eyewear, speakers, computers and smartphones, but some argue that the Age of AI calls for a new gizmo.

articles.title: Big tech on a quest for ideal AI device
articles.author: Matt Winkelmeyer
articles.summary: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has enlisted the legendary designer behind the iPhone to create an irresistible gadget for using generative artificial intelligence (AI). The ability to engage digital assistants as easily as speaking with friends is being built into eyewear, speakers, computers and smartphones.

articles.title: Teaching artificial intelligence writing hurts student creativity
articles.author: Diego Hernandez
articles.summary: According to research, the greater use of AI in classrooms has shortened students' originality and creativity. Writing is not a task to be outsourced to algorithms but a mental exercise that fosters creativity and intellectual growth. The Association of American Colleges and Universities recommends students openly disclose when they use AI and write reflections explaining how AI shaped their work.
